attributes.action: We want members of parliment to declare personal or business interests in the EU
attributes.additional_details: We have all long suspected that politicians that are supporting remain have or are receiving grants, pensions or the promise of jobs.
attributes.background: We want EACH member of parliament, political party or public speaker that refusees to support a no deal brexit, to disclose any pensions, grants, expenses, properties or any business interests that are affected by brexit either directly or indirectly and to make them publicly available.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Members of Parliament publish a regular Register of Financial Interests which you can find here:

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/standards-and-financial-interests/parliamentary-commissioner-for-standards/registers-of-interests/register-of-members-financial-interests/

Political party donations are published by the Electoral Commission.

The UK Parliament and Government are not responsible for the financial interests of public speakers.
